title: Elf (starting race)
data:
- *For other uses, see [elf](/wiki/Elf "Elf").*

You can play *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* as an **elf** @. Elves are always [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic"). They can be [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), or [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"). Playing as a random elf is a good way to focus on a small number of [roles](/wiki/Role "Role"). According to the guide book:

Elves are agile, quick, and perceptive; very little of what goes on will escape an Elf. The quality of Elven craftsmanship often gives them an advantage in arms and armor.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Racial benefits and restrictions](#Racial_benefits_and_restrictions)

- [2 Elven items](#Elven_items)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.6 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Racial benefits and restrictions

Elves have [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and they receive [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 4. From an attribute perspective, elves excel mentally, with the highest [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") and [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") of all [races](/wiki/Race "Race"). Their [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") is capped at 18, the lowest of all races. They also have the lowest [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") of all races, capped at 16. The following table outlines their maximum (unaided) attribute levels.

| Character [Race](/wiki/Race "Race") | Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| ----------------------------------- | -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| [Elf](/wiki/Elf "Elf")              | 18       | 18        | 16           | 20           | 20     | 18       |

## Elven items

- *Main article: [Elven item](/wiki/Elven_item "Elven item")*

Regular items in an elf's starting inventory are replaced with equivalent [elven items](/wiki/Elven_item "Elven item") as follows:[\[1\]](#cite_note-substitutions-1)

| Regular item                                                                 | Substitute                                                          | Affected roles                  |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                              | [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger")                   | [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") |
| [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")                                                 | [elven spear](/wiki/Elven_spear "Elven spear")                      | none currently                  |
| [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")                               | [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword")    | none currently                  |
| [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")                                                       | [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow")                            | [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") |
| [arrow](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow")                                                 | [elven arrow](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow")                      | [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") |
| [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet")                                              | [elven leather helm](/wiki/Elven_leather_helm "Elven leather helm") | none currently                  |
| [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement") | [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak")                      | [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") |
| [cram ration](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration")                               | [lembas wafer](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer")                   | [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") |

Of the classes elves can pick, only [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") are currently affected. The elven cloak is noted in the source as an intentional downgrade.[\[1\]](#cite_note-substitutions-1)

Elves have a +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") bonus and a +1 damage bonus when firing [elven arrows](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow") from an [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

Elves have poorer strength and constitution than other races, which limits their carrying capacity and maximum HP. Even at maximum strength and constitution, elves can carry 100 [units](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") less than other races.

However, elves' high wisdom or intelligence can help them cast spells they are less skilled at.

Elven [priests](/wiki/Priests "Priests") and [wizards](/wiki/Wizards "Wizards") start with a nonmagical [instrument](/wiki/Instrument "Instrument"), which can be invaluable for scaring monsters or playing the passtune at the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").

## History

In older versions of NetHack, the elf was actually a separate [role](/wiki/Role "Role"). All other roles belonged to [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"). The [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") of an elf was a [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball") called the [Palantir of Westernesse](/wiki/Palantir_of_Westernesse "Palantir of Westernesse"); it does not exist in the current version.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), elves are always [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") or [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), and they have access to far more [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") than in vanilla. The [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow") race is a chaotic counterpart to these elves.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), elves don't regenerate health ("you feel itchy") while touching iron with bare skin. Iron weapons are fine, if you are wearing gloves. However, rings are worn under gloves, so gloves don't make it safe to use iron rings. Amulets are fine, so long as they are worn over a shirt or some from of body armor. This change is somewhat balanced by the 1 AC bonus for each piece of correct racial armor worn.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), elves have [Low Light Vision](/wiki/Low_Light_Vision "Low Light Vision") 3, but lack [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and are the only race that are fully protected by [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth_\(dNetHack\) "Elbereth (dNetHack)"). Their [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") is capped at 20, but their other physical stats remain as low as in vanilla *NetHack*.

Elves can be [Anachrononauts](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut"), [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), [Convicts](/wiki/Convict "Convict"), [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Madpeople](/wiki/Madpeople "Madpeople"), [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble"), [Pirates](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate"), [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), and [Troubadours](/wiki/Troubadour "Troubadour") (Bards), in addition to the roles available to them in *NetHack*. Elven Nobles, Priests, Rangers, and Wizards may all receive the [Elvish Racial Quest](/wiki/Elvish_Racial_Quest "Elvish Racial Quest") instead of the normal role-specific quest. Elven Madpeople will encounter additional items and monsters on [their quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest"), the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes"), and the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), compared to other Madpeople. Elven Healers are always neutral (like other Healers, but unlike other elves).

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), elves take an extra die of damage when hit with iron weapons or objects - this includes the standard gnomish [aklyses](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys") and [orcish daggers](/wiki/Dagger#Orcish_dagger "Dagger"), making it quite a challenge to survive the [early game](/wiki/Game_stages "Game stages").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), iron prevents elves from regenerating health as in UnNetHack, and they also take additional damage for being hit with iron weapons.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), elves take extra damage from iron weapons and objects as in xNetHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

The Elves sat round the fire upon the grass or upon the sawn  
rings of old trunks. Some went to and fro bearing cups and  
pouring drinks; others brought food on heaped plates and  
dishes.  
"This is poor fare," they said to the hobbits; "for we are  
lodging in the greenwood far from our halls. If ever you are  
our guests at home, we will treat you better."  
"It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party," said Frodo.  
Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for  
his mind was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the  
sound of voices so various and so beautiful that he felt in a  
waking dream. \[...]  
Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to  
himself, what he felt or thought that night, though it remained  
in his memory as one of the chief events of his life. The  
nearest he ever got was to say: "Well, sir, if I could grow  
apples like that, I would call myself a gardener. But it was  
the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean."

\[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]

## References

1. ↑ [1.0](#cite_ref-substitutions_1-0) [1.1](#cite_ref-substitutions_1-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 199](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/u_init.c#L199): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 167](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/dothrow.c#L167): *multishot bonus*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 848](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/uhitm.c#L848): *damage bonus*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Elf (starting race)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For other uses, see elf.

You can play NetHack as an elf @. Elves are always chaotic. They can be Priests, Rangers, or Wizards. Playing as a random elf is a good way to focus on a small number of roles. According to the guide book:

Elves are agile, quick, and perceptive; very little of what goes on will escape an Elf. The quality of Elven craftsmanship often gives them an advantage in arms and armor.


Contents

  • 1 Racial benefits and restrictions
  • 2 Elven items
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 UnNetHack
    • 5.3 dNetHack
    • 5.4 xNetHack
    • 5.5 EvilHack
    • 5.6 SpliceHack
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Racial benefits and restrictions

Elves have intrinsic infravision and they receive sleep resistance at experience level 4. From an attribute perspective, elves excel mentally, with the highest intelligence and wisdom of all races. Their strength is capped at 18, the lowest of all races. They also have the lowest constitution of all races, capped at 16. The following table outlines their maximum (unaided) attribute levels.

Character
Race 		Strength Dexterity Constitution Intelligence Wisdom Charisma
Elf 18 18 16 20 20 18

Elven items

Main article: Elven item

Regular items in an elf's starting inventory are replaced with equivalent elven items as follows:[1]

Regular item Substitute Affected roles
dagger elven dagger Ranger
spear elven spear none currently
short sword elven short sword none currently
bow elven bow Ranger
arrow elven arrow Ranger
helmet elven leather helm none currently
cloak of displacement elven cloak Ranger
cram ration lembas wafer Ranger

Of the classes elves can pick, only Rangers are currently affected. The elven cloak is noted in the source as an intentional downgrade.[1]

Elves have a +1 multishot bonus and a +1 damage bonus when firing elven arrows from an elven bow.[2][3]

Strategy

Elves have poorer strength and constitution than other races, which limits their carrying capacity and maximum HP. Even at maximum strength and constitution, elves can carry 100 units less than other races.

However, elves' high wisdom or intelligence can help them cast spells they are less skilled at.

Elven priests and wizards start with a nonmagical instrument, which can be invaluable for scaring monsters or playing the passtune at the Castle.

History

In older versions of NetHack, the elf was actually a separate role. All other roles belonged to humans. The quest artifact of an elf was a crystal ball called the Palantir of Westernesse; it does not exist in the current version.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, elves are always lawful or neutral, and they have access to far more roles than in vanilla. The drow race is a chaotic counterpart to these elves.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, elves don't regenerate health ("you feel itchy") while touching iron with bare skin. Iron weapons are fine, if you are wearing gloves. However, rings are worn under gloves, so gloves don't make it safe to use iron rings. Amulets are fine, so long as they are worn over a shirt or some from of body armor. This change is somewhat balanced by the 1 AC bonus for each piece of correct racial armor worn.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, elves have Low Light Vision 3, but lack infravision, and are the only race that are fully protected by Elbereth. Their dexterity is capped at 20, but their other physical stats remain as low as in vanilla NetHack.

Elves can be Anachrononauts, Binders, Convicts, Healers, Madpeople, Nobles, Pirates, Rogues, and Troubadours (Bards), in addition to the roles available to them in NetHack. Elven Nobles, Priests, Rangers, and Wizards may all receive the Elvish Racial Quest instead of the normal role-specific quest. Elven Madpeople will encounter additional items and monsters on their quest, the Elemental Planes, and the Astral Plane, compared to other Madpeople. Elven Healers are always neutral (like other Healers, but unlike other elves).

xNetHack

In xNetHack, elves take an extra die of damage when hit with iron weapons or objects - this includes the standard gnomish aklyses and orcish daggers, making it quite a challenge to survive the early game.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, iron prevents elves from regenerating health as in UnNetHack, and they also take additional damage for being hit with iron weapons.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, elves take extra damage from iron weapons and objects as in xNetHack.

Encyclopedia entry

The Elves sat round the fire upon the grass or upon the sawn
rings of old trunks. Some went to and fro bearing cups and
pouring drinks; others brought food on heaped plates and
dishes.
"This is poor fare," they said to the hobbits; "for we are
lodging in the greenwood far from our halls. If ever you are
our guests at home, we will treat you better."
"It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party," said Frodo.
Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for
his mind was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the
sound of voices so various and so beautiful that he felt in a
waking dream. [...]
Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to
himself, what he felt or thought that night, though it remained
in his memory as one of the chief events of his life. The
nearest he ever got was to say: "Well, sir, if I could grow
apples like that, I would call myself a gardener. But it was
the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean."

[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]

References

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 199: Race-based substitutions for initial inventory
  2. ↑ src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 167: multishot bonus
  3. ↑ src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 848: damage bonus

Playing as a random elf is a good way to focus on a small number of [[role]]s. Elven [[priests]] and [[wizards]] start with a nonmagical [[instrument]], which can be invaluable for scaring monsters or playing the passtune at the [[Castle]]. ==History== In older versions of NetHack, the elf was actually a separate [[role]].
